soc.game

Interface ResourceSet

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SOCResourceSet

    public interface ResourceSet
    Represents an immutable set of resources To construct a mutable set, see SOCResourceSet.
    Since:
    2.0.00

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(int resourceType)
      Does the set contain any resources of this type?
      boolean contains(ResourceSet other)
      Does this set contain all resources of another set?
      int getAmount(int resourceType)
      How many resources of this type are contained in the set?
      int getResourceTypeCount()
      Get the number of known resource types contained in this set: SOCResourceConstants.CLAY to SOCResourceConstants.WOOD, excluding SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN or SOCResourceConstants.GOLD_LOCAL.
      int getTotal()
      Get the total number of resources in this set

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        int getAmount(int resourceType)
        How many resources of this type are contained in the set?
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the type of resource, like SOCResourceConstants.CLAY
        Returns:
        the number of a kind of resource
        See Also:
        contains(int), getTotal()

      • contains

        boolean contains(int resourceType)
        Does the set contain any resources of this type?
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the type of resource, like SOCResourceConstants.CLAY
        Returns:
        true if the set's amount of this resource > 0
        See Also:
        getAmount(int), contains(ResourceSet)

      • getResourceTypeCount

        int getResourceTypeCount()
        Get the number of known resource types contained in this set: SOCResourceConstants.CLAY to SOCResourceConstants.WOOD, excluding SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN or SOCResourceConstants.GOLD_LOCAL. An empty set returns 0, a set containing only wheat returns 1, that same set after adding wood and sheep returns 3, etc.
        Returns:
        The number of resource types in this set with nonzero resource counts.

      • getTotal

        int getTotal()
        Get the total number of resources in this set
        Returns:
        the total number of resources
        See Also:
        getAmount(int)

      • contains

        boolean contains(ResourceSet other)
        Does this set contain all resources of another set?
        Parameters:
        other - the subset to test against; can be null for an empty resource subset
        Returns:
        true if this contains at least the resource amounts in other for each known resource type and SOCResourceConstants.UNKNOWN. True if other is null or empty.
        See Also:
        contains(int)
